structure.unit: KENTUCKY ALCOHOL AND OTHER DRUG ABUSE PREVENTION, INTERVENTION, AND TREATMENT LAW

text.section: The programs or activities of the voluntary self-help organizations known as Alcoholics Anonymous, Narcotics Anonymous, Al-Anon, and similar organizations in the area of alcohol and other drug abuse rehabilitation shall not be restricted or regulated by the provisions of this chapter.

The programs or activities of voluntary community groups and agencies, such as Students Against Drunk Driving, National Federation of Parents, Parent Resource Institute for Drug Education, and similar organizations in the area of alcohol and other drug abuse prevention, shall not be restricted or regulated by the provisions of this chapter.

Nothing contained in this chapter shall affect any laws, administrative regulations, ordinances, resolutions, or local regulations against driving under the influence of alcohol or other drugs, or other similar offenses that involve the operation of motor vehicles, machinery, or other hazardous equipment.

law.history: Created 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 334, sec. 6, effective July 15, 1994.
